front.title: RACK: a time-based fast loss detection algorithm for TCP

abstract.t: This document presents a new TCP loss detection algorithm called RACK ("Recent ACKnowledgment"). RACK uses the notion of time, instead of packet or sequence counts, to detect losses, for modern TCP implementations that can support per-packet timestamps and the selective acknowledgment (SACK) option. It is intended to be an alternative to the DUPACK threshold approach [RFC6675], as well as other nonstandard approaches such as FACK [FACK].
